nodes.bodyText: side-comment: @trevan I somewhat wonder if originalowner should be set in the constructor so that it is always non-null. It does look like owner should be non-null as it defaults to null_player_id. Hence, it's unclear if serialization has something to do with the nullity of unit owners.

originalOwner looks to be used in extremely few places (basically, ownership of factories) so making it non-null is probably a good idea.  I would assume it should default to the value of owner.  But I don't see how that affects how owner becomes null.

But I don't see how that affects how owner becomes null.

It doesn't, at least not directly that I know of. If there is somewhere that uses original owner in place of owner, then perhaps..
